segment.source: When you boot into Manufacturing Mode, can you skip OOBE and preinstall apps to run your manufacturing tests.
segment.target: When you boot into Manufacturing Mode, can you skip OOBE and preinstall apps to run your manufacturing tests.

segment.source: Create a full operating system manufacturing profile
segment.target: Create a full operating system manufacturing profile

segment.source: Create a full operating system manufacturing profile
segment.target: Create a full operating system manufacturing profile

segment.source: When you boot into Manufacturing Mode, can you skip OOBE and preinstall apps to run your manufacturing tests.
segment.target: When you boot into Manufacturing Mode, can you skip OOBE and preinstall apps to run your manufacturing tests.

segment.source: Skipping OOBE can speed up manufacturing time.
segment.target: Skipping OOBE can speed up manufacturing time.

segment.source: To set this up, you add the apps that should be installed with the manufacturing profile.
segment.target: To set this up, you add the apps that should be installed with the manufacturing profile.

segment.source: For more info about manufacturing profiles, see Manufacturing Mode.
segment.target: For more info about manufacturing profiles, see Manufacturing Mode.

segment.source: Add apps to a custom manufacturing profile
segment.target: Add apps to a custom manufacturing profile

segment.source: In a manufacturing mode profile, you must create a new registry key that lists the apps that should be installed with the manufacturing profile:
segment.target: In a manufacturing mode profile, you must create a new registry key that lists the apps that should be installed with the manufacturing profile:

segment.source: Under the OOBEInstall registry key, you must create registry key (with REGDWORD type) for each app.
segment.target: Under the OOBEInstall registry key, you must create registry key (with REGDWORD type) for each app.

segment.source: The name of the registry key must match the filename of the app package.
segment.target: The name of the registry key must match the filename of the app package.

segment.source: For example, to add the Settings app to the manufacturing profile, you would add a registry key named systemsettings.
segment.target: For example, to add the Settings app to the manufacturing profile, you would add a registry key named systemsettings.

segment.source: Here are some things to consider when adding apps to a manufacturing profile:
segment.target: Here are some things to consider when adding apps to a manufacturing profile:

segment.source: The manufacturing profile must not disable any Windows services.
segment.target: The manufacturing profile must not disable any Windows services.

segment.source: The value of the registry key is reserved.
segment.target: The value of the registry key is reserved.

segment.source: Only the registry key name is used.
segment.target: Only the registry key name is used.

segment.source: The app can be a first or second party app, but the app package must be a part of the image.
segment.target: The app can be a first or second party app, but the app package must be a part of the image.

segment.source: The wildcard can be used in the name of the app.
segment.target: The wildcard can be used in the name of the app.

segment.source: If you want the normal OOBE experience (with all apps installed), create a single registry key with the name of .
segment.target: If you want the normal OOBE experience (with all apps installed), create a single registry key with the name of .

segment.source: Find the name of the app
segment.target: Find the name of the app

segment.source: The name of the registry key must match the filename of the app package.
segment.target: The name of the registry key must match the filename of the app package.

segment.source: You can get a list of the apps that are on the device by running the following command on the device's drive root:
segment.target: You can get a list of the apps that are on the device by running the following command on the device's drive root:

segment.source: This command returns a list of files, similar to the following:
segment.target: This command returns a list of files, similar to the following:

segment.source: The part of the filename after MPAP and before 0xx.provxml is what you should use for the registry key name.
segment.target: The part of the filename after MPAP and before 0xx.provxml is what you should use for the registry key name.

segment.source: Add the registry keys to your custom manufacturing profile package
segment.target: Add the registry keys to your custom manufacturing profile package

segment.source: You add the registry keys to your custom manufacturing profile package like you would with any other package.
segment.target: You add the registry keys to your custom manufacturing profile package like you would with any other package.

segment.source: For more info about packaging, see Creating Phone Packages.
segment.target: For more info about packaging, see Creating Phone Packages.
